ai-mn143:15.1_0: When he said this, Anāthapiṇḍika cried and burst out in tears.
ai-mn143:15.3_0: “Are you failing, householder? Are you fading, householder?”
ai-mn143:15.5_0: But for a long time I have paid homage to the Buddha and the esteemed mendicants.
ai-mn143:15.6_0: Well, I haven’t heard such a Dhamma talk.”
ai-mn143:15.7_0: “Householder, it does not occur to us to teach such a Dhamma talk to white-clothed laypeople.

ai-mn143:16.1_0: And when the venerables Sāriputta and Ānanda had given the householder Anāthapiṇḍika this advice they got up from their seat and left.
ai-mn143:16.2_0: Not long after they had left, Anāthapiṇḍika passed away and was reborn in the host of Joyful Gods.
ai-mn143:17.1_0: Then, late at night, the glorious god Anāthapiṇḍika, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha. Thinking,
ai-mn143:17.1_1: and after approaching and worshipping the Fortunate One, he stood on one side.
ai-mn143:17.2_0: Standing to one side, the god Anāthapiṇḍika addressed the Buddha in verse:
ai-mn143:17.4_0: frequented by the Saṅgha of hermits,
ai-mn143:17.5_0: where the King of Dhamma stayed:
ai-mn143:17.14_0: and thus be purified in it.
ai-mn143:18.1_0: This is what the god Anāthapiṇḍika said.
ai-mn143:18.4_0: Then that deity, knowing that the teacher approved, bowed and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.
ai-mn143:19.1_0: Then, when the night had passed, the Buddha told the mendicants all that had happened.
ai-mn143:19.2_0: “Mendicants, tonight, a certain glorious god, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, came to me.
ai-mn143:19.2_1: and after approaching and worshipping me, he stood on one side.
ai-mn143:19.3_0: Standing to one side, the god Soṇa addressed me in verse:
ai-mn143:19.5_0: frequented by the Saṅgha of hermits,
ai-mn143:19.6_0: where the King of Dhamma stayed:
ai-mn143:19.15_0: and thus be purified in it.
ai-mn143:19.21_0: Then that deity, knowing that my teacher approved, bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right, before vanishing right there.”
ai-mn143:20.1_0: After this was said, venerable Ānanda addressed the Fortunate One, (saying):
ai-mn143:20.2_0: “Sir, that god must surely have been Anāthapiṇḍika.
ai-mn143:20.3_0: For the householder Anāthapiṇḍika was devoted to Venerable Sāriputta.”
ai-mn143:20.5_0: You’ve reached the logical conclusion, as far as logic goes.
ai-mn143:20.6_0: For that was indeed the god Anāthapiṇḍika.”
ai-mn143:20.7_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-mn143:20.8_0: Satisfied, Venerable Ānanda was happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-mn143:20.9_0: The first section on Anāthapiṇḍika is finished.
